name: Gmail Capabilities
description: Evaluation dataset for Gmail subagent capabilities including email composition, reading, organizing, and managing drafts. Includes lazy queries, intentional mistakes, and ambiguous items requiring resolution.

items.input: send email to john@example.com about the meeting tomorrow
items.expected_output: 1. Compose email to john@example.com. 2. Add subject about meeting tomorrow. 3. Send email.
items.context: User wants to send a simple email

items.input: show me my unread emails
items.expected_output: Fetch emails with unread filter and display list.
items.context: User wants to see unread emails

items.input: create draft for sarah@company.com with subject 'Project Update' and tell her the deadline is extended to Friday
items.expected_output: Create email draft with recipient sarah@company.com, subject 'Project Update', body about deadline extension.
items.context: User wants to create a draft email

items.input: reply to the last email from mike about the budget
items.expected_output: 1. Search emails from Mike about budget. 2. Find the thread. 3. Reply to the thread.
items.context: User wants to reply to a specific email thread

items.input: forward the invoice email to accounting@company.com
items.expected_output: 1. Search for email containing 'invoice'. 2. Forward to accounting@company.com.
items.context: User wants to forward without specifying exact email

items.input: label all emails from newsletter@example.com as promotions
items.expected_output: 1. List labels to get promotions label ID. 2. Fetch emails from newsletter@example.com. 3. Add label to each email.
items.context: User wants to bulk label emails

items.input: create a new label called 'Important Clients'
items.expected_output: Create new Gmail label named 'Important Clients'.
items.context: User wants to create a custom label

items.input: delete the draft about quarterly report
items.expected_output: 1. List drafts. 2. Find draft about quarterly report. 3. Delete draft.
items.context: User wants to delete a specific draft

items.input: send my saved draft to the marketing team
items.expected_output: 1. List drafts. 2. Identify relevant draft. 3. Send the draft.
items.context: User wants to send an existing draft

items.input: what emails did I receive from amazon last week
items.expected_output: Search emails from Amazon with date filter for last week and display results.
items.context: User wants to search emails with sender and date

items.input: move email from bob to trash
items.expected_output: 1. Search for recent email from bob. 2. Move email to trash.
items.context: User provided incomplete info about which email

items.input: send email to sara@company.com and cc her manager at manager@company.com about Q4 results
items.expected_output: Compose and send email with To: sara@company.com, CC: manager@company.com, subject/body about Q4 results.
items.context: User wants to send email with CC

items.input: check my gmial profile
items.expected_output: 1. Recognize 'gmial' as typo for 'gmail'. 2. Get Gmail profile information.
items.context: User made typo in 'gmail'

items.input: find emails with attachments from this month
items.expected_output: Search emails with has:attachment filter and date range for current month.
items.context: User wants to find emails with attachments

items.input: show me the conversation thread with alex about the contract
items.expected_output: 1. Search emails from/to Alex about contract. 2. Fetch message by thread ID to show full conversation.
items.context: User wants to see email thread

items.input: remove the 'Work' label from all emails older than 6 months
items.expected_output: 1. List labels to find Work label ID. 2. Fetch emails with Work label older than 6 months. 3. Batch modify to remove label.
items.context: User wants bulk label removal

items.input: who sent me the most emails this week
items.expected_output: 1. Fetch emails from this week. 2. Analyze senders. 3. Report top sender.
items.context: User wants email analytics

items.input: list all my labels
items.expected_output: Retrieve and display all Gmail labels including system and custom labels.
items.context: User wants to see available labels

items.input: mark the email from HR as read
items.expected_output: 1. Search for email from HR. 2. Modify email labels to remove UNREAD.
items.context: User wants to mark email as read

items.input: compose email to team@company.com with HTML formatting including bold heading and bullet points
items.expected_output: Create email with HTML body containing bold text and list elements, set is_html=True.
items.context: User wants HTML formatted email

items.input: search for emails containing 'quarterly report' in subject
items.expected_output: Search emails with subject:quarterly report query.
items.context: User wants subject-specific search

items.input: get my contacts list
items.expected_output: Fetch contacts from Gmail account.
items.context: User wants to see contacts

items.input: search contacts for john
items.expected_output: Search people/contacts for name matching 'john'.
items.context: User wants to find a contact

items.input: show me drafts
items.expected_output: List all email drafts with details.
items.context: User wants to see saved drafts

items.input: update the draft for john to add a PS about the deadline
items.expected_output: 1. List drafts. 2. Find draft for john. 3. Update draft body to add PS section.
items.context: User wants to modify existing draft

items.input: archive all emails from notifications@social.com
items.expected_output: 1. Fetch emails from notifications@social.com. 2. Batch modify to add ARCHIVE label / remove INBOX.
items.context: User wants to bulk archive

items.input: how many emails do I have total
items.expected_output: Get Gmail profile to retrieve total message count.
items.context: User wants email statistics

items.input: permanently delete all emails in trash
items.expected_output: 1. Fetch emails with label TRASH. 2. Ask for user confirmation. 3. Batch delete messages.
items.context: User wants to empty trash - destructive action
